bwwExcerpt: Like most critics, I thought "A Doll's House, Part 2," the what-if sequel to Ibsen by Lucas Hnath, was already great when it opened in April. But a play's true greatness may hinge on how well it absorbs, or reshapes itself around, the succession of casts that enact it. That was going to be a high bar in this case. The entire original foursome - Laurie Metcalf, Chris Cooper, Jayne Houdyshell and Condola Rashad - was nominated for Tony Awards; deservedly, Ms. Metcalf won. Still, the new cast in pl
